title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to iucnrdata
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to iucnrdata
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to iucnrdata
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("PaulESantos/iucnrdata", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to iucnrdata
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to iucnrdata
text: Please note iucnrdata project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: IUCN Species Data 2024 — iucn_2024
text: dataset containing IUCN Red List conservation status various species, including subspecies subpopulations. data includes species scientific names, threat categories, additional information core ID rank.

title: IUCN Species Data 2024 — iucn_2024
text: tibble  166,503  rows 7 columns: category character. IUCN Red List category species, indicating risk extinction. Categories include "CR" (Critically Endangered), "EN" (Endangered), "VU" (Vulnerable), "LC" (Least Concern), "NT" (Near Threatened), "DD" (Data Deficient), others. threat_status character. descriptive representation conservation status, corresponding IUCN Red List category, e.g., "Critically Endangered", "Vulnerable", "Least Concern". core_id integer. unique identifier species subspecies within dataset. scientific_name character. scientific name species, including genus species epithet. subspecies character. subspecies name, applicable. rank character. taxonomic rank species level, "var." (variety) "subsp." (subspecies). subpopulation character. specific subpopulation designation, applicable, species divided distinct subpopulations.

title: IUCN Species Data 2024 — iucn_2024
text: International Union Conservation Nature (IUCN) Red List 2024.

title: IUCN Species Data 2024 — iucn_2024
text: dataset provides conservation status determined IUCN Red List 2024. data includes species subspecies subpopulation-level classifications available. Subpopulations identified species, specific subpopulations assigned threat statuses separately.

title: IUCN Species Data 2024 — iucn_2024
code: # Load the data data(iucn_2024)  # View the first few rows of the dataset head(iucn_2024) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   category threat_status  core_id scientific_name subspecies rank  subpopulation #>   <chr>    <chr>            <int> <chr>           <chr>      <chr> <chr>         #> 1 DD       Data Deficient  1.31e8 Aa calceata     NA         NA    NA            #> 2 DD       Data Deficient  1.31e8 Aa mandonii     NA         NA    NA            #> 3 DD       Data Deficient  1.31e8 Aa matthewsii   NA         NA    NA            #> 4 DD       Data Deficient  2.05e8 Abarema ferrug… NA         NA    NA            #> 5 DD       Data Deficient  1.67e5 Abbottina binhi NA         NA    NA            #> 6 DD       Data Deficient  4.26e4 Abditomys lati… NA         NA    NA

what: IUCN Red List Taxon Data — iucn_data
title: IUCN Red List Taxon Data — iucn_data
text: dataset contains taxonomic information IUCN Red List Threatened Species, downloaded GBIF website. includes detailed taxonomic classifications conservation status species across various kingdoms, offering comprehensive view species listed Red List.

title: IUCN Red List Taxon Data — iucn_data
IUCN Red List Taxon Data — iucn_data
text: tibble 150,490 rows 21 variables: search_name character. search-friendly version species' scientific name. core_id character. unique identifier linking taxon data distribution threat status data. scientific_name character. full scientific name taxon, including authorship. kingdom character. kingdom classification taxon (e.g., PLANTAE). phylum character. phylum classification taxon. class character. class taxon. order character. taxonomic order taxon. family character. taxonomic family taxon belongs. genus character. genus taxon belongs. specific_epithet character. specific epithet taxon, forming species name along genus. scientific_name_authorship character. author(s) described taxon. taxon_rank character. rank taxon (e.g., species, subspecies, variety). infraspecific_epithet character. epithet infraspecific taxa, subspecies varieties, applicable. infrasp_tag character. Indicator rank infraspecific taxa (e.g., subspecies, variety, forma). taxonomic_status character. taxon's status, indicating whether accepted name synonym. accepted_name_usage_id integer. identifier accepted name synonyms, core ID accepted names. bibliographic_citation character. citation taxon entry IUCN Red List. references character. URL link IUCN Red List entry taxon. source character. source distribution data. threat_status character. IUCN conservation status species (e.g., "Endangered", "Least Concern", "Vulnerable"). occurrence_status character. Indicates whether taxon present absent given locality (e.g., "Present", "Absent"). data sourced two primary files: taxon.txt: Provides taxonomic information, including scientific names, taxon ranks, accepted name usage IDs. distribution.txt: Contains information IUCN threat status occurrence taxon.

title: IUCN Red List Taxon Data — iucn_data
text: IUCN Red List Threatened Species, available GBIF: https://www.gbif.org/dataset/19491596-35ae-4a91-9a98-85cf505f1bd3

title: IUCN Red List Taxon Data — iucn_data
code: # Load the data data(iucn_data)  # View the first few rows of the dataset head(iucn_data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 21 #>   search_name    core_id scientific_name kingdom phylum class order family genus #>   <chr>          <chr>   <chr>           <chr>   <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr>  <chr> #> 1 Calocedrus ru… 133722  Calocedrus rup… PLANTAE TRACH… PINO… PINA… CUPRE… Calo… #> 2 Narthecium re… 157938  Narthecium rev… PLANTAE TRACH… LILI… DIOS… NARTH… Nart… #> 3 Asparagus hum… 158019  Asparagus humi… PLANTAE TRACH… LILI… ASPA… ASPAR… Aspa… #> 4 Bulbostylis b… 158236  Bulbostylis bo… PLANTAE TRACH… LILI… POAL… CYPER… Bulb… #> 5 Bulbostylis h… 158275  Bulbostylis hi… PLANTAE TRACH… LILI… POAL… CYPER… Bulb… #> 6 Ophrys melite… 162229  Ophrys meliten… PLANTAE TRACH… LILI… ASPA… ORCHI… Ophr… #> # ℹ 12 more variables: specific_epithet <chr>, #> #   scientific_name_authorship <chr>, taxon_rank <chr>, #> #   infraspecific_epithet <chr>, taxonomic_status <chr>, #> #   accepted_name_usage_id <int>, bibliographic_citation <chr>, #> #   references <chr>, source <chr>, threat_status <chr>, #> #   occurrence_status <chr>, infrasp_tag <chr>

what: IUCN Red List Vernacular Names Data — vernacular_name
title: IUCN Red List Vernacular Names Data — vernacular_name
text: dataset contains vernacular (common) names species included IUCN Red List Threatened Species. vernacular names provided various languages, species, multiple common names exist. vernacular name linked taxon core dataset unique identifier.

title: IUCN Red List Vernacular Names Data — vernacular_name
IUCN Red List Vernacular Names Data — vernacular_name
text: tibble 156,417 rows 4 variables: core_id integer. unique identifier linking vernacular name corresponding taxon core dataset. language character. language vernacular name provided, using standard language codes (e.g., "fra" French, "eng" English). vernacular_name character. common vernacular name species specified language. is_preferred_name logical. Indicates whether vernacular name preferred name (TRUE) alternative name (FALSE). dataset provides essential information understanding common names species different languages, can useful local conservation efforts public communication species.

title: IUCN Red List Vernacular Names Data — vernacular_name
text: IUCN Red List Threatened Species, available GBIF: https://www.gbif.org/dataset/19491596-35ae-4a91-9a98-85cf505f1bd3

title: IUCN Red List Vernacular Names Data — vernacular_name
code: # Load the data data(vernacular_name)  # View the first few rows of the dataset head(vernacular_name) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   core_id language vernacular_name        is_preferred_name #>     <int> <chr>    <chr>                  <lgl>             #> 1  157938 FRA      Narthécie de Reverchon TRUE              #> 2  157938 FRA      Ossifrage de Reverchon FALSE             #> 3  162229 MLT      Brimba Sewda           FALSE             #> 4  162229 ENG      Maltse Spider Orchid   TRUE              #> 5  163990 FRA      Héléocharis des Marais FALSE             #> 6  163990 ENG      Common Spike-rush      TRUE
